results.title: Effect of treatment with simvastatin on serum cholesteryl ester transfer in patients on dialysis. PERFECT Study Collaborative Group.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: These data show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ therapy reduces serum NCET rates, and suggest that this may be linked to the concomitant decrease in levels of @GENE_APOB @GENE_338 @@@apoB@@@-containing lipoproteins which are acceptors of transferred @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol_Esters @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002788 @@@cholesteryl esters@@@, and to the decrease in serum @GENE_LCAT @GENE_3931 @@@LCAT@@@ rates in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@chronic renal failure@@@ with treatment.

citations.NLM: Walker RJ, Sutherland WH, Walker HL, MacMahon S, Robson RA. Effect of treatment with simvastatin on serum cholesteryl ester transfer in patients on dialysis. PERFECT Study Collaborative Group. Nephrol Dial Transplant. 1997 Jan;12(1):87-92. PMID: 9027779
